text: Once upon a time, in a codebase far, far away...
It was the night before Christmas, and all through the repo...
Not a single pipeline was failing‚Äînot even a flake or two.
Pull requests were hung by the pipeline with care,
In hopes that the CI/CD soon would be there.
The engineers were nestled all snug at their desks,
While visions of merged branches danced in their heads.
With code reviews done and commit messages read,
They took a quick nap, ignoring the dreaded 'Needs Rebase' thread.
When out on the Slack channel there arose such a clatter,
I sprang from my spinny chair to see what was the matter.
Away to the console I flew like a flash,
Tore open the logs, hoping the server didn't crash.
The moon on the bytes of the new-pushed code,
Gave the luster of midnight releases about to explode.
When, what to my wondering eyes should appear,
But a miniature release note, and eight fresh unit tests, oh dear!
With a little old driver, so agile and quick,
I knew in a moment it must be St. Nick‚Äî Wait, that‚Äôs not quite right...
Actually, it was just Jenkins, wearing a Santa hat!
He whistled, and shouted, ‚ÄúAll jobs are green, how about that!‚Äù
He ran all the lints, to his team gave a wave,
Deploying fresh code from GitHub to live.
Happy Holidays from your friendly dev environment!
May your commits be clean and your builds be serene!
~ End of our unusual tale ~
